text: Preparing the tofu and kimchi Put a nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Once it’s hot, add olive oil and spread it around with a spatula. You will see tiny bubbles forming once the oil is hot enough. Add the tofu, making sure to spread the pieces out. Salt and pepper lightly. Fry the tofu for about five minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Remove from the pan. Put the same pan over medium heat and add the vegan butter. Once it’s melted, add the kimchi. It is a good idea to turn on the vent if you haven’t done so already. It can get pretty smokey! You might want to adjust the heat if it looks too high, because you don’t want the kimchi to burn before it cooks through. Let the kimchi fry for 4 minutes or until the kimchi looks browned and tender, and the kimchi juice gets caramelized.  Assembling the sandwich Slice the focaccia cross-wise. Spread each side generously with the avocado aioli, and stack with the fried tofu and kimchi. Finished.
